Issues.Title: fix(ivy): evaluate external declaration usages as dynamic
Issues.Body:
Previously, ngtsc would fail to evaluate expressions that access properties
from e.g. the `window` object. This resulted in hard to debug error messages
as no indication on where the problem originated was present in the output.

This commit cleans up the handling of unknown property accesses, such that
evaluating such expressions no longer fail but instead result in a `DynamicValue`.

Fixes #30226
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ivy): evaluate external declaration usages as dynamic" (#30247)

Issues.Title: fix(core): fix interpolate identifier in AOT
Issues.Body:
This commit fixes a regression introduced in PR 29692 where
the interpolate symbol in View Engine was improperly prefixed
with the …µ…µ that signifies private instructions for Ivy. It
resulted in interpolations of 10+ values not working correctly
in AOT mode. This commit removes the prefix.

(I'm unable to add a good test for AOT given the way VE tests 
are set up, but I've added one for JIT).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(core): fix interpolate identifier in AOT" (#30243)

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): align NgModule registration timing with ViewEngine
Issues.Body:
Currently in Ivy `NgModule` registration happens when the class is declared, however this is inconsistent with ViewEngine and requires extra generated code. These changes remove the generated code for `registerModuleFactory`, pass the id through to the `ngModuleDef` and do the module registration inside `NgModuleFactory.create`.

This PR resolves FW-1285.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ivy): align NgModule registration timing with ViewEngine" (#30244)

# üìö Docs or angular.io bug report

### Description

When using the chrome URL bar search functionality to search angular.io with multiple words the search terms are encoded to replace the space with a `+` character. This is causing the search results to find no results.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

To trace through the issue from the beginning... In the browser URL bar type "angular.io reactive forms" (note this needs to be typed and not pasted to trigger the search functionality.

With the search term

https://angular.io/?search=reactive+forms

### Expected vs Actual Behavior**
Expected: search results should show for search criteria containing a space.
Actual: due to the `+` there are no search results found

Entering the search criteria:

Issues.Title: Ivy mode with 8.0.0-rc.2: Ivy's error message doesn't help to localize the error
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report

### Affected Package
@angular/compiler

### Is this a regression?

I just tried to migrate to Ivy mode: edited tsconfig.app.json ("enableIvy": true, "allowEmptyCodegenFiles": true), and package.json ("postinstall": "ivy-ngcc"), and finally run "npm install".

### Description

The Ivy compiler issues an error message which doesn't help to localize the error:

## üî• Exception or Error

I get such an error message:

`ERROR in __ng_typecheck__.ts(108,41): error TS2532: Object is possibly 'undefined'.`

After painful stripping down the whole angular app and removing lots of code I found that Ivy has troubles with these lines:
```
<section class="mt-1" *ngIf="buch !== undefined">
   <hs-details-bearbeiten [id]="buch._id"></hs-details-bearbeiten>
```

## üåç  Your Environment

Angular CLI 8.0.0-rc.2, Windows 10 Enterprise

**Angular Version:**

8.0.0-rc.2
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Ivy mode with 8.0.0-rc.2: Ivy's error message doesn't help to localize the error" (#30235)

Issues.Title: fix(upgrade): preserve $interval.flush when ngMocks is being used
Issues.Body:
## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [x] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
The UpgradeModule wraps the AngularJS `$interval` service with some zonejs-related behaviour necessary for a hybrid app. angular-mocks also decorates `$interval` with a `flush` method for testing. Currently, the UpgradeModule does not add the $flush method (if present) on the original $interval to its wrapper. This causes an "$interval.flush is not a function" error if you are initializing the UpgradeModule in an existing angularjs test that uses angular-mocks and $interval.flush. 

(I am initializing the UpgradeModule in an angularjs test because one of the components in the code under test is now an Angular component that is being used in AngularJS with `downgradeComponent`).
 
Issue Number: N/A


## What is the new behavior?
This PR adds the `$interval.flush` method to the UpgradeModule's $interval wrapper, so existing angularjs tests that use `$interval.flush` can also use downgraded components. 

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No


<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->


## Other information
I am currently looking for the correct place to introduce a test for this code.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(upgrade): preserve $interval.flush when ngMocks is being used" (#30229)

Issues.Title: How to build Cordova Web view application using Kendo Angular 7 components?
Issues.Body:
We are building an Angular 7 mobile app that will be integrated with a third party hybrid app (using standard HTML/JS technology) over which we have no control. They will call our function/app by launching a Webview (and URL) to pass control to us. Our app/functions then almost like a but in the Webview.

Generally, this is not a problem but we are trying to take advantage of the native controls that Cordova provides in a Hybrid app or access to via .

Do you have a sample app or an example or a build process on how to do this?

 It seems that it works with vanilla HTML app but not with Angular 7 app.

Thanks.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "How to build Cordova Web view application using Kendo Angular 7 components?" (#30228)

Issues.Title: template strategy & usage strategy need more definition
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package @angular/core ### Is this a regression? no ### Description Upon using `ng update` to move to 8.0.0-rc.2 (or later), I get the following prompt: ``` ------ Static Query migration ------ In preparation for Ivy, developers can now explicitly specify the timing of their queries. Read more about this here: https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/28810 There are two available migration strategies that can be selected: ‚Ä¢ Template strategy - migration tool (short-term gains, rare corrections) ‚Ä¢ Usage strategy - best practices (long-term gains, manual corrections) For an easy migration, the template strategy is recommended. The usage strategy can be used for best practices and a code base that will be more flexible to changes going forward. ? What migration strategy do you want to use? ``` This prompt doesn't include enough information for me to decide, and the linked PR doesn't talk about these strategies. Issues.Title: docs: router - improve docs on the imports order of multi routing modules
Issues.Body:
# üìö Docs or angular.io bug report ### Description For the section https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/aio/content/guide/router.md#import-crisis-center-module-into-the-appmodule-routes in the router.md doc. The current text is: > Import crisis center module into the AppModule routes > As with the HeroesModule, you must add the CrisisCenterModule to the imports array of the AppModule before the AppRoutingModule: The **placement** order in the **imports array of the AppModule** shall be highlighted with a Notice or Warning, since the natural way of doing the hero tutorial is adding the crisis-center module with the crisis-center routing using the angular-cli after the app module. The angular-cli creates the import of crisis-center module after the AppRoutingModule. This will be an issue for the code. When a **Wildcard route** is defined in the **AppRoutingModule**, the wildcard route will be matched before the child route in the crisis-center routing can be matched. This happens very often wenn using the angular-cli to added submodule with routing feature. The natrual way of adding Wildcard route is in the AppRoutingModule, and then always place the AppRoutingModule after all submodule in the import array of the AppModule. The debugging of such error relating to the routes match due to the import placement order is very difficult. Thus, i suggest to improve the original doc text to hightlight this issue to prevent error in coding and improve the readers understanding of the impact of the placement order in the imports array of the angular modules. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction ### What's the affected URL?** https://angular.io/guide/router#import-crisis-center-module-into-the-appmodule-routes ### Reproduction Steps** ### Expected vs Actual Behavior** ## üì∑Screenshot ## üî• Exception or Error
## üåç Your Environment ### Browser info ### Anything else relevant?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "docs: router - improve docs on the imports order of multi routing modules" (#30223)

Issues.Title: support live editing in the browser
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ 

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
@angular/core / docs?


### Description
Angular should support ability to quickly edit, compile and load components in the browser without complex server-side compilation.
This is possible with other languages / frameworks, including angular.js!, svelte, scala.js, and others. (see https://svelte.dev/examples, https://scalafiddle.io/)

### Describe the solution you'd like
If this is currently possible (with ivy?), please add documentation (or even an example).
Otherwise, please publish a roadmap for support or explain what is the critical issue.


### Describe alternatives you've considered
repl.it codesandbox stackblitz do manage to recreate such an experience by including code that almost replicates node's/npm's capabilities (+ some server side support).

Seems to me like an unreasonably complex, expensive (in term of dev time and maintenance),  and low-performance implementation. I want to create a website with dynamically created and edited components (i.e., IDE for specific domains). I did so in the past using iced-coffeescript+angular.js (browser-side compilation), I wish I could also write such code with Angular.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "support live editing in the browser" (#30222)


I did a simple check by replacing this:

```
  return this.http.get(filename, {responseType: 'text'})
    .subscribe(
        data => this.log(filename, data),
        error => this.logError(filename, error)
    );
```

by this:

```
  return this.http.get(filename, {responseType: 'text'})
    .pipe(
      tap( // Log the result or error
        data => this.log(filename, data),
        error => this.logError(filename, error)
      )
    );
```

The error went away, but I can't resolve my promise inside the tap so it's not really useful for me. Any idea what's going wrong?

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): properly tree-shake away StaticInjector
Issues.Body:
Ivy uses R3Injector, but we are currently pulling in both the StaticInjector
(View Engine injector) and the R3Injector when running with Ivy. This commit
adds an ivy switch so calling Injector.create() pulls in the correct
implementation of the injector depending on whether you are using VE or Ivy.
This saves us about 3KB in the bundle.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(ivy): properly tree-shake away StaticInjector" (#30219)

Issues.Title: fix(@schematics/angular): project name option in the library schematic index
Issues.Body: The change fixes the passed `project` option to the module, component, and service schematics used in the library schematic (`schematics/angular/library/index.ts`). Originally, `options.name` used to be passed to the respective schematics. In the case of a scoped project, however, the passed `project` option will be incorrect/incomplete due to the stripped scope from `option.name` performed earlier during the execution (https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/master/packages/schematics/angular/library/index.ts#L184).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@schematics/angular): project name option in the library schematic index" (#14330)

Issues.Title: fix(@schematics/angular): insertAfterLastOccurrence AST util
Issues.Body: The introduced change fixes a bug in the `insertAfterLastOccurrence` AST utility function which is part of the `@schematics/angular` package. By design, the function should be able to insert a string in an empty node list, hence the `fallbackPos` argument. However, the check performed in the function implementation itself blocks the user to do so; an error is thrown instead.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@schematics/angular): insertAfterLastOccurrence AST util" (#14329)

Issues.Title: fix(@schematics/angular): reduce package installs for 8.0 migrations
Issues.Body: At most one package manager install will now be executed for 8.0 migrations.  This provides a ~30% performance improvement for a hello world project.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@schematics/angular): reduce package installs for 8.0 migrations" (#14324)

Issues.Title: fix(@schematics/angular): avoid tslint overhead for lazy module migration
Issues.Body:
By using a pure schematic based implementation the overhead of running tslint can be removed.  This also has the benefit of allowing direct control over the files loaded and to modify files only within the schematic tree context.
For a hello world application, there was a ~20% performance improvement for the CLI migration from 7.0 to 8.0 as well as a ~10% reduction in memory usage.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@schematics/angular): avoid tslint overhead for lazy module migration" (#14323)

It looks like it does not like the name `rxjs01` for a project created with `--enableIvy=true`. Issues.Title: refactor(@angular/cli): avoid aggressive eager command loading
Issues.Body:
Currently, upon execution `ng` will load all description files and code for all available commands.  This requires a large amount of unnecessary file access and processing since only at most one command will be executed.  This change limits the loading to only the command being executed in the common case and a subset of commands in the event an alias is used.  The help command now loads all commands during its execution which is needed to gather command description information.  Further improvements are possible by only loading the necessary metadata instead of the execution code (and its dependencies) as well.
This change allows for savings of ~250ms per execution and reduces memory consumption by 10-20 MBs depending on the command.

Examples:
Before -- `./node_modules/.bin/ng version  0.99s user 0.17s system 113% cpu 1.020 total`
After -- `./node_modules/.bin/ng version  0.70s user 0.13s system 110% cpu 0.749 total`

Before -- `./node_modules/.bin/ng g c a  1.91s user 0.30s system 111% cpu 1.996 total`
After -- `./node_modules/.bin/ng g c a  1.62s user 0.27s system 110% cpu 1.715 total`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(@angular/cli): avoid aggressive eager command loading" (#14312)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): live reload cannot be disabled
Issues.Body:
By default the application will be served with inline mode enabled. This means that a script will be inserted in your bundle to take care of live reloading.

However at the moment we are already adding these scripts in `_addLiveReload` method.

With this change we always disable this behaviour and only add it when needed via the `_addLiveReload` logic.

Eventually we should try to remove the logic and rely on webpack-dev-server interals.

Fixes #14300
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): live reload cannot be disabled" (#14301)

Issues.Title: Disable sourcemaps on @angular-devkit/build-angular:server
Issues.Body: # üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [X ] build - [X] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? I am not sure. ### Description You need to add sourceMap: false to the server builder because including the sourcemaps on each page, causes alot of overhead, Facebook is not able to see past the first MB on a site, and adding an extra 100 KB on top of Material already loading in SSR, is just going to cause bundle sizes to be huge for no reason, I ask that you include this in the angular.json file. "server": { "builder": "@angular-devkit/build-angular:server", "options": { "outputPath": "dist/server", "main": "src/main.server.ts", "sourceMap": false, "tsConfig": "src/tsconfig.server.json" }, "configurations": { "production": { "fileReplacements": [ { "replace": "src/environments/environment.ts", "with": "src/environments/environment.prod.ts" } ] } } ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Set up a new SSR project using the steps in the angular.io, then take a look at the angular.json ## üî• Exception or Error You will not see an error, ## üåç Your Environment Angular CLI: 7.3.6 Node: 10.15.3 OS: darwin x64 Angular: 7.2.10 ... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms ... http, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic ... platform-server, router, service-worker Package Version ----------------------------------------------------------- @angular-devkit/architect 0.13.6 @angular-devkit/build-angular 0.13.6 @angular-devkit/build-optimizer 0.13.6 @angular-devkit/build-webpack 0.13.6 @angular-devkit/core 7.3.6 @angular-devkit/schematics 7.3.6 @angular/cdk 7.3.5 @angular/cli 7.3.6 @angular/fire 5.1.0 @angular/material 7.3.5 @angular/pwa 0.13.6 @ngtools/webpack 7.3.6 @schematics/angular 7.3.6 @schematics/update 0.13.6 rxjs 6.4.0 typescript 3.2.4 webpack 4.29.0 **Anything else relevant?** This was a very hard issue for me to debug, if you are using SSR, and wondering why certain sites can see your meta tags, and others can't, it's probably because of the inclusion of sourcemaps could be breaking their file size limits.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Disable sourcemaps on @angular-devkit/build-angular:server" (#14304)

Issues.Title: Support glyph-name in svgs, so offical material-design-icon repo can be imported as iconset
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
I don't want to use ligatures, because I'm using other custom svgIcons. Due to the bizarre way mat-icon works, working with both svgIcon and ligatures is a nightmare.

So the natural solution is to consolidate all icons into a single place.

Using this webfont: https://github.com/google/material-design-icons/blob/master/iconfont/MaterialIcons-Regular.svg

I should be able to import this as an iconset. But because this library insists on an arbitrary svg structure, I can't do it. I have to mess around and manually convert the svg file to a format that angular material likes. **Where's the instructions/guide on how to achieve this**? Looks like a huge pain that shouldn't be there.

Doing some simple replace/find on the webfont doesn't work, the resulting svg is blown up and hidden from view.

#### What is the current behavior?
The offical google angular material iconset should be easily able to import using `matIconRegistry.addSvgIconSet`.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
Try to use the above linked file, it won't work.


#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Latest

Issues.Title: Focus on selected menu item when re-open mat-menu (using keyboard or Mouse)
Issues.Body:
#### feature request:
Focus should be on the selected menu item when user re-open the mat-menu

#### What is the expected behavior?
Let's say there are 4 menu items in mat-menu and user selects the 3rd menu item. Now, when user re-open the mat-menu. the focus should be on "item-3" and now if user press down arrow key the focus should move to "item-4". 

#### What is the current behavior?
Considering the above scenario, on re-opening mat-menu, the default focus is on the first item " item-1" and on pressing down arrow key the focus moves to "item-2" instead of "item-4" (as user selected "item-3")

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-l9enb6


#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
Better user experience

Issues.Title: mat-menu: In IE, mat-menu-panel with xPosition before and vertical scrollbar shifts to the left and doesn't align correctly
Issues.Body:
#### Overview
Menus with too many menu items in them will cause the mat-menu-panel with xPosition="before" to shift to the left and not line up correctly with the right edge of the button in IE browser. Consequently, if you add a set max-height to the mat-menu-panel to override the default 100vh calculation, the panel is still shifted to the left in IE. 

#### Bug, feature request, or proposal: Bug


#### What is the expected behavior?
mat-menu with xPosition="before" shouldn't shift left and should align correctly to the right even if the number of menu items exceed the max-height of panel in IE.

#### What is the current behavior?
mat-menu with xPosition="before" and menu items that exceed max-height of panel causes the panel to shift to the left and not align with button in IE.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
[StackBlitz](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-c4k7nt)

Add enough items to mat-menu with xPosition="before" until menu panel exceeds max-height. 

Screenshot shows correct behavior in FF and Chrome. Incorrect behavior is seen in last screen in IE:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17503018/57039707-f5cc3700-6c22-11e9-9299-189046dbd2dd.png)

Screenshot shows incorrect behavior in IE when overriding max-height as well:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17503018/57039757-244a1200-6c23-11e9-8671-7083c4f2c522.png)

#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
Menus should display consistently across all browsers for consistent user experience. 

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Windows
Angular: 7.0.3
Material: 7.0.4
TypeScript: 3.1.6
Browsers: IE only
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "mat-menu: In IE, mat-menu-panel with xPosition before and vertical scrollbar shifts to the left and doesn't align correctly" (#15934)

Issues.Title: fix(drag-n-drop): ignore consecutive touchmove events on drag item on multitouch
Issues.Body:
Bumped into an inconsistent behaviour on multitouch. Currently the DragDropRegistry is designed atop of Set, and assumes there could be only one pointer active on item. Which is not true for multitouch devices.  

So there‚Äôre two ways to fix it:
1. Teach DragDropRegistry to respect multiple simultaneous pointers on one item.
2. Stick to Set as designed initially, respect only the first pointer on item, and properly ignore all consecutive pointers.

The first way looks much more promising, but requires much more effort and requires attention of core team, I suppose. The second one is not that flexible, but is still more consistent than the current implementation. So this commit implements the second way.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(drag-n-drop): ignore consecutive touchmove events on drag item on multitouch" (#15923)

Issues.Title: Dynamic steps with form validity checks not working with stepper component
Issues.Body:
I am struggling to get a dynamic behavior for a component which uses a `mat-vertical-stepper`.

Essentially, a particular step should be removable in case some required data is already available which would render it redundant.

The main idea would be to use `*ngIf` on a `mat-step` element:

```html
<mat-step *ngIf="requirePersonalInfo">
  <!-- .. -->
</mat-step>
```

which essentially works but it seems this does not work if we use the built-in error checking.

Here is an example: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-5hds7p?file=app%2Fstepper-errors-example.html

Before clicking the checkbox on top, it is not possible to move to the second step. After clicking it however, inserts the second step but does not prevent me from moving to the next step anymore.

> Also: Unchecking the checkbox results in two form being rendered at once. The step 2 form slides in from the right while the step 1 form is still visible.

Here is the same stepper but *without* any dynamic behavior just to show that it works as such: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-5hds7p-a9nsv7?file=app/stepper-errors-example.html

My current workaround is to set all elements as touched after the user clicked on "next" and check if the form is valid: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-5hds7p-1agpxc?file=app%2Fstepper-errors-example.html

I have seen https://github.com/angular/components/issues/11791 and https://github.com/angular/components/pull/9132 but I don' think they are related.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Dynamic steps with form validity checks not working with stepper component" (#15919)

Issues.Title: feat(popover-edit): accessible row hover content
Issues.Body:
Hover content is now additionally shown when the row has focus or an active edit.
Further, to maintain sane tab ordering, the first and last rows as well as the rows immediately above and below the currently focused row are kept in the dom but are visually hidden.

The mat-hover-content directive now works properly in non-editable table cells.

Also includes some optimizations to event/observable usage at startup that reduce startup latency by about 40ms with 500 rows and 2 edits per row.
Savings will be higher when there are more edits per row.
Improved how we re-enter the NgZone to trigger far fewer calls to ApplicationRef.tick (performance improvement will vary by app).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(popover-edit): accessible row hover content" (#15917)

Issues.Title: In mat-select, make the multiple value separator configurable
Issues.Body:
#### Please describe the feature you would like to request.

The mat-select is currently hard-coded to use a comma as the delimiter for displaying multiple values:

https://github.com/angular/components/blob/058ed0f66c80bd21f254d825946cde9bdb6db2e6/src/material/select/select.ts#L687

Please add a configurable property for the delimiter.

#### What is the use-case or motivation for this proposal?

Localization, as well as semantics, i.e. ability to use AND or OR as the separator.

#### Is there anything else we should know?

Nope.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "In mat-select, make the multiple value separator configurable" (#15915)

Issues.Title: Autocomplete selection with mouse focusing body
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?

When I select an option via mouse click, it should focus the input element. This works correctly when navigating to correct option with arrow keys and pressing enter.

The issue is that if I present the autocomplete within a dropdown or dialog element that closes when a click/focus is detected outside of itself, the drop down/dialog will close everytime a mat autocomplete option is selected via mouse.

#### What is the current behavior?
after a mouse selection behave the same way as a keyboard/enter selection. Dont focus the body just send focus back to input.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?

styling is shit obviously but start typing a city in the drop down, if you key down and press enter you'll notice the drop down doesn't close. but if you use mouse to select it does close.

https://stackblitz.com/edit/create-shvowk?file=app%2Fapp.component.ts
#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
material 7.3.3

#### Is there anything else we should know?
